text: The SEC filed a lawsuit against a crypto exchange alleging unregistered securities offerings and improper customer asset handling.
A European regulator issued a €25 million fine to a crypto broker for AML compliance failures and record-keeping violations.
The White House convened banks and crypto firms for a policy meeting to discuss market structure legislation and stablecoin rules.
A securities watchdog published guidance clarifying that tokenized equities remain subject to existing securities laws and disclosure requirements.
A central bank announced a pilot programme for wholesale CBDC settlement with commercial banks and regulated payment firms.
The finance ministry launched a government-backed blockchain registry to track tokenized bond issuance and settlement.
A public company disclosed it added 18,000 BTC to its corporate treasury as a long-term reserve asset.
A global asset manager announced it will offer tokenized fund shares to institutional clients through a regulated digital platform.
A crypto exchange filed confidentially for an IPO in the United States as public markets reopen to digital asset firms.
A crypto custody firm made its market debut on the NYSE, with shares surging on the first day of trading.
A major exchange acquired a regulated broker-dealer to expand institutional access and custody services.
A Layer-2 developer raised $45 million in a Series B led by a strategic corporate VC to accelerate ecosystem growth.
DeFi TVL on a major chain jumped 22% week-over-week as new incentives attracted liquidity providers.
Bitcoin plunged 8% intraday amid a broader risk-off selloff before recovering into the close.
A listed mining company reported quarterly revenue up 35% and improved margins due to higher network fees.
A stablecoin issuer published an attestation showing reserves increased and cash equivalents now represent the majority of backing assets.
The company appointed a new CEO and CFO as it scales institutional custody and compliance operations.
A crypto payments firm announced a restructuring that includes business unit consolidation and senior management changes.
A wallet provider pivoted away from NFT features to focus on stablecoin payments and merchant integrations.
A crypto broker is pivoting to become a regulated prime services platform, prioritizing custody and lending over retail trading.
The network activated a hard fork to introduce new fee markets and improved validator incentives.
Validator count declined 40% from last year as operator costs rose and staking rewards fell.
A new Layer-1 launched mainnet with staking enabled and an initial validator set of 120 operators.
A USD-backed stablecoin launched for retail users on multiple exchanges with onchain mint and redeem enabled.
A cross-chain bridge added support for a new rollup, enabling USDC transfers and faster finality.
A major wallet released an update adding account abstraction support and safer transaction simulations.
A centralized exchange disclosed a security breach that resulted in unauthorized withdrawals from hot wallets.
An attacker exploited a DeFi lending protocol via a price oracle manipulation, draining $18 million in assets.
A major token unlock is scheduled this week, releasing 2.5% of circulating supply to early investors.
The protocol burned 120 million tokens using revenue from fees, reducing total supply and increasing scarcity.
A dollar stablecoin briefly depegged to $0.97 during heavy redemptions before recovering to $1.00.
A bank warned stablecoin adoption could drain deposits and reduce funding for traditional lending by 2028.
Onchain lending rates fell as liquidity returned, pushing stablecoin borrow APRs below 4% across major markets.
Staking yields rose after a validator commission change, lifting average staking APR to 9.2%.
A fund manager issued tokenized U.S. Treasury bills onchain, enabling 24/7 settlement and programmable transfers.
Tokenized gold trading volumes surged as spot gold rallied, with onchain products outpacing several traditional ETFs.
A payments app enabled stablecoin transfers for merchants, allowing customers to pay with USDC at checkout.
A remittance provider expanded crypto-to-fiat payouts using stablecoins to reduce fees for cross-border transfers.
A major exchange partnered with a Layer-2 network to support native deposits, withdrawals, and onchain staking.
Two DeFi protocols announced an integration to share liquidity and enable cross-protocol collateral use.
A prominent crypto researcher published an analysis of MEV trends and wallet behavior, sparking debate across the community.
A major conference highlighted new developer tools, ecosystem grants, and network roadmap updates without a single dominant headline event.
European airlines reported higher quarterly profits as fuel prices fell and passenger volumes increased.
A smartphone maker unveiled a new flagship device featuring an upgraded camera system and longer battery life.
The SEC reached a settlement with a crypto lender over unregistered securities sales, requiring restitution and compliance undertakings in the United States.
The UK FCA announced a settlement with a digital asset broker over marketing breaches, including a penalty and customer remediation plan in the UK.
The EU proposed restrictions under MiCA to limit retail access to leveraged crypto derivatives, tightening rules for platforms operating in the European Union.
Japan’s regulator issued new restrictions on token listings, requiring enhanced disclosures for exchanges serving customers in Japan.
The DOJ opened an investigation into a crypto market-making firm for alleged wash trading and wire fraud in the United States.
Canada’s CSA confirmed an investigation into a crypto platform over custody practices and misleading disclosures to Canadian investors.
The SEC issued a cease and desist order against a token issuer for selling unregistered securities to U.S. investors.
The UK FCA served a cease and desist notice to a crypto promotions firm for unlawful financial advertising in the UK.
A draft bill introduced in the United States would create a federal framework for stablecoin issuers and define oversight between the SEC and CFTC.
The EU launched a consultation on a regulatory framework for tokenized securities under MiCA and capital markets rules in the European Union.
A crypto custody firm is in IPO planning talks for a Nasdaq float in the United States, according to bankers familiar with the process.
A UK-based crypto payments company began IPO planning with advisers, exploring a London listing in the UK.
A crypto miner secured a NYSE listing through an up-list process, expanding access for U.S. investors.
A regulated exchange operator completed a listing on the HKEX to fund expansion of its Hong Kong digital asset business.
Nasdaq approved the delisting of a crypto infrastructure stock after it failed to meet minimum bid requirements in the United States.
A UK-listed blockchain services firm announced it will be delisted following a takeover, ending trading on the UK market.
USDC stablecoin supply increased after $1.2B was minted this week, lifting total stablecoin supply across major chains.
Stablecoin supply contracted as $800M was burned following redemptions, reducing circulating stablecoin supply market-wide.
A major exchange launched bitcoin options and new perpetuals, expanding derivatives trading for global users.
A crypto exchange launched derivatives and perpetuals for retail customers in the UK, adding new options-style products under FCA expectations.
Shareholders approved a governance proposal to separate the chair and CEO roles at a U.S. crypto company after a contentious board vote in the United States.
A governance dispute erupted at a UK-listed crypto firm as the board rejected a shareholder proposal demanding enhanced disclosures in the UK.
The protocol executed a scheduled mint of 50 million tokens as part of its emissions program, increasing new token issuance this epoch.
Developers confirmed a one-time mint to fund grants, with 2% of supply minted into a treasury controlled by governance.
Governance approved a new emissions schedule that reduces inflation, changing the token supply growth rate starting next month.
A protocol proposal would raise annual inflation and expand circulating supply via higher staking emissions if passed.
A stablecoin issuer published a reserves update showing more U.S. Treasury bills and fewer commercial paper holdings, according to its attestation.
The issuer released a reserves update verified by an EU auditor, detailing cash equivalents backing and changes to its European Union reserve composition.
A stablecoin product began offering stablecoin yield via tokenized U.S. Treasury collateral, advertising a 4.5% yield to U.S. users.
A Hong Kong platform rolled out stablecoin yield accounts, paying yield on USDC deposits to customers in Hong Kong.
The issuer changed monetary mechanics by introducing daily mint and redeem windows and a new fee schedule for U.S. institutions.
A stablecoin operator updated monetary mechanics to include an onchain redemption queue and capped issuance for users in Singapore.
A validator failure caused missed blocks and partial finality delays after several operators went offline in Singapore.
The network reported a validator failure and temporary halt in block production after a bug affected U.S. operators, according to incident updates in the United States.
A major chain experienced an incident involving a two-hour outage and delayed transactions, with postmortem shared by the core team.
Validators reported an incident that triggered slashing events after misconfiguration, impacting stakers on the network.
A central bank-registered USD stablecoin launched in the UAE after approval in Abu Dhabi, enabling regulated issuance and redemption.
A UK FCA-registered stablecoin launched with regulated onboarding in the UK, positioning itself as a compliant dollar token.
A new protocol launched a public testnet beta with staking simulations and faucet tokens ahead of mainnet.
Developers launched an incentives beta for a new protocol on a limited devnet, inviting validators to join early.
The team announced a mainnet upgrade scheduled for next week, with a coordinated rollout across validators and exchanges.
A mainnet upgrade went live after governance approval, enabling new consensus parameters and improved throughput.
The protocol upgrade introduced a new fee mechanism and revised staking rules, with nodes required to update software to stay in sync.
An upgrade proposal passed to change block times and improve finality, prompting operators to install the new release.
A cross-chain router added cross_chain swaps between Ethereum and a rollup, enabling faster cross-chain transfers for users.
A new cross_chain messaging standard launched with support from developers in Japan, aiming to improve cross-chain interoperability.
Core infrastructure development introduced a new client release and improved node performance, reducing hardware requirements for operators.
An infrastructure development team shipped a new SDK and tooling for wallets and bridges, accelerating developer integration work.
A crypto exchange reported a hack that drained customer funds from hot wallets, prompting emergency withdrawals suspension in the United States as the SEC requested details.
A Hong Kong exchange disclosed a hack affecting its hot wallet infrastructure, with investigators coordinating response in Hong Kong.
Attackers used an exploit against a crypto exchange API to bypass rate limits and initiate unauthorized withdrawals, the DOJ said in the United States.
An exploit targeting an exchange’s withdrawal system triggered losses, with the UK FCA urging affected customers in the UK to remain vigilant.
A crypto exchange confirmed a breach after attackers obtained internal credentials and accessed operational systems, according to a statement filed in the United States.
A breach at an exchange exposed customer emails and triggered forced password resets, the company said in the European Union.
A mining pool announced a shutdown after sustained losses, ending operations and returning remaining balances to users.
A Bitcoin mining operator in Canada said it will shut down facilities after power costs rose sharply, citing Canada in its update.
Mining operations halted temporarily after a data center outage disrupted hash rate, with service expected to resume within hours.
A mining facility in Australia reported a halt due to extreme heat and grid constraints, citing Australia in its operations notice.
